Reason: The 'tracetype_repair_ttl' configuration is performance-sensitive. This is because the configuration directly impacts the duration for which repair trace sessions are stored and tracked, affecting memory consumption and storage space utilization. The code related to this configuration involves operations that handle the TTL values for repair trace sessions, which can be time-expensive and memory-expensive. The notable performance impact at the system level is due to the potential increase in memory usage and storage space consumption based on the TTL value set for repair trace sessions.
